abstract:
<jats:p>A moderately halophilic, motile, Gram-negative, rod-shaped bacterium, strain LC6<jats:sup>T</jats:sup>, was isolated from a water sample of lake Laguna Colorada in the Bolivian Andes. The major cellular fatty acids were C<jats:sub>18 : 1</jats:sub>
                  <jats:italic>ω</jats:italic>7<jats:italic>c</jats:italic>, iso-C<jats:sub>16 : 1</jats:sub>
                  <jats:italic>ω</jats:italic>7<jats:italic>c</jats:italic> 2-OH, C<jats:sub>16 : 0</jats:sub> and C<jats:sub>12 : 0</jats:sub> 3-OH. The respiratory ubiquinones found in strain LC6<jats:sup>T</jats:sup> were Q-9 (97 %) and Q-8 (3 %). Strain LC6<jats:sup>T</jats:sup> was aerobic, heterotrophic, and able to utilize various carbohydrates and other substrates as carbon source. The G+C content of the genomic DNA of strain LC6<jats:sup>T</jats:sup> was 52.5 mol%. The organism was able to grow at pH 6.0–11.0 (optimum, pH 7.0–8.0), at 4–45 °C (optimum, 30–35 °C) and in the presence of 0.5–20 % (w/v) NaCl (optimum, 1–3 %, w/v). Based on 16S rRNA gene sequence analysis, strain LC6<jats:sup>T</jats:sup> was most closely related to <jats:italic>Halomonas hydrothermalis</jats:italic> DSM 15725<jats:sup>T</jats:sup> and <jats:italic>Halomonas venusta</jats:italic> DSM 4743<jats:sup>T</jats:sup> (98.8 % similarity), followed by <jats:italic>Halomonas aquamarina</jats:italic> DSM 30161<jats:sup>T</jats:sup>, <jats:italic>Halomonas axialensis</jats:italic> DSM 15723<jats:sup>T</jats:sup> and <jats:italic>Halomonas meridiana</jats:italic> DSM 5425<jats:sup>T</jats:sup> (98.4 %). However, levels of DNA–DNA relatedness between strain LC6<jats:sup>T</jats:sup> and the above type strains were low (<31 %). Strain LC6<jats:sup>T</jats:sup> resembled recognized <jats:italic>Halomonas</jats:italic> species with respect to various physiological, biochemical and nutritional characteristics. Combined phenotypic data and DNA–DNA hybridization data supported the conclusion that strain LC6<jats:sup>T</jats:sup> represents a novel species of the genus <jats:italic>Halomonas</jats:italic>, for which the name <jats:italic>Halomonas andesensis</jats:italic> is proposed. The type strain is LC6<jats:sup>T</jats:sup> (=CCUG 54844<jats:sup>T</jats:sup>=LMG 24243<jats:sup>T</jats:sup>=DSM 19434<jats:sup>T</jats:sup>).</jats:p>
title: Halomonas andesensis sp. nov., a moderate halophile isolated from the saline lake Laguna Colorada in Bolivia
